p: The compounds identified in the oregano essential oil are in a volatility range of 100–325 ° C and are classified as semivolatiles. The presence or absence of these compounds in the fractions is determined by the time and temperature range of the process according to the scheme of Figure 1. The most volatile terpenes in this group of compounds are present in F1 and F2, while the less volatile are present in F3 and F4. Some compounds, such as o-cymene and γ-terpinene, are present in different amounts in F1 to F3 and are almost insignificant in F4 and Unoil. These compounds were distilled little by little during the process. Less volatile terpenes such as carvacrol, trans-caryophyllene and α-humulene were detected in Unoil. Ooil contains all the terpenes found in the fractions and Unoil, but in different proportions. It is worth noting the absence of oxidized compounds, such as aldehydes and ketones, which indicates a self-protection of the oil to oxidation [ 2].
